0: 0 is the year that nothing interesting came to pass.
1: 1 is the year that Emperor Ping of Han China begins his reign and Wang Mang is re-instated as regent by Grand Empress Dowager Wang.
2: 2 is the year that Gaius Caesar meets with Phraates V, the king of Parthia on the Euphrates.
3: 3 is the year that the rule of emperor Augustus is renewed for a ten-year period.
4: 4 is the year that Emperor Caesar Augustus summons Tiberius to Rome, and names him his heir and future emperor.
5: 5 is the year that Tiberius conquers Germania Inferior.
6: 6 is the year that Augustus banishes Agrippa Postumus, one of his adopted sons, to the island of Planasia.
7: 7 is the year that Publius Quinctilius Varus is appointed governor of Germania.
8: 8 is the year that Vipsania Julia is exiled.
9: 9 is the year that Wang Mang founds the short-lived Xin Dynasty in China (until 25).
10: 10 is the year that Publius Cornelius Dolabella is a Roman consul.
11: 11 is the year that Artabanus II of the Arsacid Dynasty becomes ruler of Parthia.
12: 12 is the year that the Armenian Artaxiad Dynasty is overthrown by the Romans.
13: 13 is the year that Abgarus of Edessa is reinstalled as king of Osroene.
14: 14 is the year that a census indicates that there are 4,973,000 Roman citizens.
15: 15 is the year that Valerius Gratus is appointed Prefect of Iudaea.
16: 16 is the year that Ovid's "Epistulae ex Ponto" appears.
17: 17 is the year that Herod Antipas, son of Herod the Great, builds on the western shore of the Sea of Galilee, the city Tiberias in honor of Tiberius.
18: 18 is the year that a vexillatio (sub-unit) of Legio III Augusta is destroyed by an ambush in Africa.
19: 19 is the year that Maroboduus, king of the Marcomanni, is deposed by Catualda.
20: 20 is the year that Servius Sulpicius Galba is a Roman praetor.
21: 21 is the year that the Romans create a buffer state in the territory of the Quadi in southern Slovakia.
22: 22 is the year that the consuls are Decimus Haterius Agrippa and Gaius Sulpicius Galba.
23: 23 is the year that Liu Xuan, a descendant of the Han Dynasty royal family and leader of insurgents against the Xin Dynasty, proclaims himself emperor against Wang Mang.
24: 24 is the year that Philo declares that the Old Testament is the eternal law of God.
25: 25 is the year that the Han dynasty is restored in China as Liu Xiu proclaims himself Emperor, starting the Jianwu era (until 56).
26: 26 is the year that Emperor Tiberius retires to Capri, leaving the Praetorian Guard under Lucius Aelius Sejanus in charge of the Roman Empire and the city of Rome.
27: 27 is the year that Lucius Calpurnius Piso and Marcus Licinius Crassus Frugi become Roman consuls.
28: 28 is the year that the Frisians negotiate a treaty with the Romans at the River Rhine, avoiding conquest.
29: 29 is the year that Agrippina the Elder is exiled to the island of Pandataria, and her sons (except Caligula) are imprisoned by Lucius Aelius Sejanus.
30: 30 is the year that the Sermon on the Mount (according to proponents of the 33 theory, although 27 or 28 is more likely).
31: 31 is the year that Naevius Sutorius Macro becomes the leader of the Praetorian Guard after Sejanus is executed.
32: 32 is the year that Symbolic interpretation of the OT by Philo (Allegory).
33: 33 is the year that Emperor Tiberius founds a credit bank in Rome.
34: 34 is the year that Naevius Sutorius Macro is said to gain favour in the empire by prostituting his wife Eunius to Caligula.
35: 35 is the year that Pliny the Elder is brought to Rome before this year.
36: 36 is the year that Herod Antipas suffers major losses in a war with Aretas IV of Nabatea, provoked partly by Antipas' divorce of Aretas' daughter.
37: 37 is the year that an earthquake destroys Antioch on April 9th.
38: 38 is the year that Phaedrus writes his popular collection of fables.
39: 39 is the year that Philo leads a Jewish delegation to Rome to protest the anti-Jewish conditions in Alexandria.
40: 40 is the year that the emperor Caligula is consul without colleague.
41: 41 is the year that Claudius makes Agrippa king of Judea.
42: 42 is the year that the territories of the current Algeria and Morocco become a Roman province.
43: 43 is the year that the Romans now have complete control of the Mediterranean.
44: 44 is the year that Judaea is controlled by Roman governors.
45: 45 is the year that Salzburg (Juvavum) is awarded the status of a Roman municipium.
46: 46 is the year that a drought and an invasion of locusts hit the Mongolian steppes, causing a famine and a revolt at Xiongnu.
47: 47 is the year that Gnaeus Domitius Corbulo is made commander of the Roman army in Germania Inferior, he conquers the Chauci and fights against the Cherusci and Frisians.
48: 48 is the year that Vitellius is a Roman Consul.
49: 49 is the year that Nero becomes engaged to Claudia Octavia, daughter of Claudius.
50: 50 is the year that the distinction between chronic maladies and acute illnesses is made by Thessalos.
51: 51 is the year that the New Testament book 1 Thessalonians is written (possible date).
52: 52 is the year that Emperor Claudius attempts to control the Fucine Lake by digging a 5,6 km tunnel through Monte Salviano, requiring 30,000 workers and eleven years.
53: 53 is the year that Nero marries Claudia Octavia.
54: 54 is the year that Corbulo inspects in Syria a base of Legio X Fretensis at Cyrrhus, the Roman legionnaires are demoralized by a "long peace".
55: 55 is the year that the Roman jurist Sabinus writes three books on the rights of citizens.
56: 56 is the year that Publius Clodius Thrasea Paetus becomes a consul in Rome.
57: 57 is the year that a Japanese king sends an ambassador to China.
58: 58 is the year that the apostle Paul is arrested in Jerusalem, and is imprisoned in Caesarea.
59: 59 is the year that Paul the Apostle pleads his case and testifies of Christianity before king Agrippa II.
60: 60 is the year that Paul of Tarsus journeys to Rome, but is shipwrecked at Malta.
61: 61 is the year that Publius Petronius Turpilianus and Lucius Caesennius Paetus become Roman consuls.
62: 62 is the year that Lucan writes a history of the conflict between Julius Caesar and Pompey.
63: 63 is the year that Aulus Cornelius Celsus writes a dictionary (encyclopedia) on the arts and sciences.
64: 64 is the year that the year the First Epistle of Peter is traditionally believed to be written.
65: 65 is the year that the Gospel of Matthew is probably written between 60 and this year.
66: 66 is the year that the Zealots lay siege on Jerusalem and annihilate the Roman garrison (a cohort of Legio III).
67: 67 is the year that Nero, jealous of the success of Corbulo in Armenia, orders that he be put to death.
68: 68 is the year that the Roman Senate accepts emperor Galba on June 8th.
69: 69 is the year that Legio I Macriana liberatrix is disbanded.
70: 70 is the year that the Third Wall of Jerusalem collapse and the Jews withdrew from Bezetha to the Second Wall, where the defences are unorganized on May 25th.
71: 71 is the year that Mithraism begins to spread throughout the Roman Empire.
72: 72 is the year that the Romans lay siege to Masada, a desert fortress held by Jewish victims of the Sicarii.
73: 73 is the year that Pliny the Elder serves as procurator in Hispania Tarraconensis.
74: 74 is the year that the Black Forest region is reattached to the Roman Empire.
75: 75 is the year that Caerwent is founded by the Romans as the market town of Venta Silurum, a settlement of the Silures.
76: 76 is the year that Emperor Vespasianus Augustus and Titus Caesar Vespasianus become Roman Consul.
77: 77 is the year that a Roman squadron, sent by Agricola, explores the north of Scotland for the first time, discovering the Orkney and Shetland Islands.
78: 78 is the year that this is the base year (year zero) of the Saka era used by some Hindu calendars, the Indian national calendar, and the Cambodian Buddhist calendar.
79: 79 is the year that Emperor Titus dedicates the famous Roman Colosseum.
80: 80 is the year that the aeolipile, the first steam engine, is described by Hero of Alexandria.
81: 81 is the year that the Arch of Titus is constructed.
82: 82 is the year that Gnaeus Julius Agricola raises a fleet and encircles the Celtic tribes beyond the Forth, the Caledonians rise in great numbers against the Romans.
83: 83 is the year that Inchtuthil, Roman fort built in Scotland.
84: 84 is the year that Pliny the Younger is sevir equitum Romanorum (commander of a cavalry squadron).
85: 85 is the year that Emperor Domitian repulses a Dacian invasion of Moesia.
86: 86 is the year that Germany is divided into two provinces, Upper Germany and Lower Germany.
87: 87 is the year that Decebalus becomes king of Dacia.
88: 88 is the year that Pope Clement I succeeds Pope Anacletus I as the fourth pope.
89: 89 is the year that Legio XIII Gemina is transferred to Dacia to help in the war against Decebalus.
90: 90 is the year that Emperor Domitian and Nerva are Roman Consuls.
91: 91 is the year that Rome is described by Statius in his poems.
92: 92 is the year that the Roman army moves into Mesopotamia.
93: 93 is the year that the Xianbei incorporates 100,000 Xiongnu in Mongolian steppe.
94: 94 is the year that the Roman poet Statius retires to Naples from Rome.
95: 95 is the year that Manius Acilius Glabrio is commanded by Domitian to descend into the arena of the Colosseum to fight a lion.
96: 96 is the year that Marcus Ulpius Traianus becomes governor of Upper Germany.
97: 97 is the year that the Roman colony of Cuicul is started in Numidia.
98: 98 is the year that the silver content of the Roman denarius rises to 93 percent under emperor Trajan, up from 92 percent under Domitian.
99: 99 is the year that nothing remarkable happened.
100: 100 is the year that Main hall, Markets of Trajan, Rome, is made (until 112).
